question_text: A technician replaces a failed drive in a RAID 1 array and forgets to initiate the rebuild. What is the likely result?
answer_options: The system will automatically reformat all drives
The array remains degraded and at risk
The array becomes faster due to reduced parity checks
The mirror will self-correct without user intervention
correct_answer: The array remains degraded and at risk
explanation: Without initiating the rebuild process, the mirror will not sync, and the array remains vulnerable to failure.
